boat.name: Frances Webber
boat.full_description:
'Frances Webber', formerley 'Alice Pellow', is a Cornish Crabber Pilot cutter 30, a well built, traditionally styled family cruiser with plenty of space below deck and enjoyable well-mannered performance.

These pretty boats attract attention wherever they go and have excellent windward ability. The lifting keel is ideal for coastal cruising. 'Alice' was re-fitted in 2014 and sails regularly with the OGA, she changed hands in 2019 when her name was changed to 'Frances Webber'.
boat.short_description:
Alex Kimble commissioned 'Alice Pellow' from new in 1989, naming her after his Granny.

Les May re-named her in 2019 after his Grandmother, Frances Webber, who was originally from Plymouth and sister of decorated naval brothers from WW2.

owners.note: Alex Kimble commissioned Alice Pellow from new in 1989. He named the boat after his Granny. The previous owner from Don Sayer was Ian Weston, prior to 1999.
owners.text: Alex Kimble commissioned Alice Pellow from new in

for_sales.sales_text:
Pilot Cutter P20 “Frances Webber” was originally named “Alice Pellow” after the first owner’s grandmother.

The gaff rigged cutter has a full suite of sails including topsail on jack staff and a flying jib as well as the standard cutter rig. A modern cruising chute is also available.

Although looking like a gaff rigged classic the hull is a very solid GRP moulding with flexiteek deck . The wooden mast, spars and steving bowsprit complete the look of a modern classic. Indeed, when fitting out, Alice Pellow featured in “Classic Boat” magazine . A lifting keel reduces draft from about 1.6meters to just over a meter and the vessel is fitted with mounting points for substantial wooden beaching legs (included).

Frances Webber benefits from a host of modern upgrades over the last few years including:

  • a new Yanmar 3YM30hp engine (2016)
  • new mast and spray hood (2014)
  • new prop shaft and seals (2017)
  • Raymarine autopilot and other instrumentation (2015-2021)
  • new headlining & LED lighting throughout (2021)
  • professional mains electric installation (2019)
  • new gas hob/oven and professional gas pipework installation (2018)
  • new standing rigging (2021)
  • refurbished Jabsco heads (2019)
  • new 150L flexi water tank and pressurised cold water system (2020)
  • Standard Horizon VHF with AIS and deck mounted remote handset.

Frances Webber adopts the roomier layout below of having two very large quarter berths aft with airy heads forward allowing a longer saloon than the alternative forward “A berth” layout.

For reluctant sale due to family illness
